SENT.plain: Three children have been presented who have had long-standing, typical systemic juvenile rheumatoid arthritis
They also had a transient illness with thrombocytopenia, antiplatelet antibodies, and the simultaneous appearance of anti-DNA antibodies and hypocomplementemia
Other single abnormalities included the development of a positive ANA, Coombs, and lupus bands test
All responded to high-dose steroid therapy
Their similar clinical and serologic findings are noteworthy and represent one of the numerous complications seen in patients with systemic juvenile rheumatoid arthritis
